Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (734) 395-0920.

Sincerely,

ALLEGATION:
On 7/17/22, youth were outside playing basketball with staff members. One staff
and youth engaged in a verbal argument and staff member pushed youth. Staff
2

member was taunting youth. Management intervened and separated the staff
member and youth. Staff member was put on administrative leave.
INVESTIGATION:
A complaint was received on 6/18/22 stating around 8:25pm that Youth A and other
youth were outside playing basketball with some of the staff, including Staff 1. Staff 1
and Youth A got into a heated argument. Staff 1 pushed Youth A. The two continued
to argue. Staff 1 taunted Youth A saying he wanted Youth A to push him. At that
point management intervened and the two were separated. Youth A did not sustain
any injuries. Staff 1 was put on administrative leave.
Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/20/22 along with the DHHS
Worker. He said he was outside playing basketball with Youth B, Youth C, and Staff
1. There were more people, but he could not remember who. Youth C began to call
Youth A names and it escalated with Youth A getting in Youth C's face. Youth A said
Staff 1 pushed Youth A. He stated Staff 1 was standing on the side of him when he
did this. He said he did not fall but Staff 1 did push him hard. Youth A told Staff 1 not
to put his hands on him. He thought Staff 4 was present. Youth A was already mad,
and this made him more mad. Youth A said that it is not normal for a staff to push
kids. He did not know if Staff 1 was mad.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/20/22. Youth B stated Youth
A and Youth C were getting into it and Youth A was in Youth C's face. Staff 1 pulled
Youth A back and tried to de-escalate him. Youth A was upset and was in Staff 1's
face talking smack like "I'll beat your ass." Youth B said Staff 1 pushed Youth A out
of his face and said he would break Youth A's spine. Staff 1 then got his stuff and
left. Everyone else went inside. Youth B could not remember who else was around.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/20/22. He reported him and
Youth A were playing basketball and Youth C was trying to keep Youth A from
getting the ball. Youth A got upset with Youth C and got in his face. Staff 1 came up
and pushed Youth A. Youth C said that Staff 1 did not push Youth A hard enough to
make him fall to the ground. Youth A then told Staff 1 not to touch him. He did not
know what Staff 1 said to Youth A, but Staff 1 did have his fists balled up. Staff 1
walked up to Youth A. Staff 1 was mad, but Youth C did not know why. Nothing else
happened. Youth C said Staff 4 was there, but he could not remember who else was
present.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/28/22. He reported he went
outside to the basketball court and saw Youth A and Staff 1 arguing. He did not hear
what they were saying. He saw Staff 1 walk up to Youth A. When Staff 4 got to them
he heard Youth A tell Staff 1 to hit him so he could be fired. Staff 4 said he helped
3

Youth A leave the situation because he has a good rapport with him. Staff 4 did not
see what occur prior to him arriving.
Staff 2/Complainant was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/28/22. She
reported around bedtime she went out to the basketball court to tell the group to go
in for bedtime. Youth A was observed to be upset and Youth A and Staff 1 began to
cuss at each other. Staff 1 told Youth A to "shut the fuck up." Youth A then told staff
1 to do the same then he said to hit him so he could be fired. Staff 2 said that Staff 1
was getting upset and looked as though he was preparing for a fight and had an
aggressive stance. Staff 2 said Staff 1 pulled his pants up and went toward Youth A.
Staff 1 then pushed Youth A with two hands on his shoulders. Youth A was facing
Staff 1 when this happened. Youth A did not fall. Staff 2 and other staff separated
the two of them. Staff 4 took Youth A and she told Staff 1 to walk away. Staff 2
called her manager who informed her to tell Staff 1 he needed to leave immediately
and for Staff 2 to take his keys. Staff 1 did not say anything when Staff 2 told him
this. Staff 1 resigned the following day.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/28/22. Staff 3 reported they
are taught to be aware of themselves and to know their limits when dealing with
youth who are upset. They are taught not to argue with the youth. Staff 3 said she
had worked with Staff 1 prior to this incident. She stated he had an arrogant attitude,
and she knew the kids would test him because of this. On the night of the incident,
they were all outside. Staff 3 said she was sitting on the bench by the basketball
court while Staff 1, Youth A, and some other boys were playing basketball. Youth A
called Staff 1 a name and Staff 1 told Youth A to "shut your soft ass up. I'll break
your ass down little boy." The two of them were in each other’s faces. Staff 1 then
pushed Youth A with one hand on his chest and Youth A took a couple of steps
back. Staff 1 walked away laughing. Staff 3 did not know where Staff 1 went.
Another staff took Youth A away.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face outside his home on 8/8/22. Staff 1 reported he
had only been off training for 6 days when the incident occurred. He said he had two
weeks of training prior to working. He did not have any disciplines. He was working
from 2pm to 10pm on the day of the incident. After dinner and before bed the youth
went outside to play basketball. Staff 1 said he played basketball with the youth. At
8:09pm Staff 4 came out to tell them it was time to go in to get ready for bed. Staff 1
saw a commotion to his left and said Youth A had approached Youth C and was in
his face. Youth A was swearing at Youth C and threatening to “beat his ass.” He
went over to them and grabbed Youth A to turn him away from Youth C as he is
taught to do in training. Youth A became mad at Staff 1 and cussed at him. Youth A
told Staff 1 he could not do anything, and Staff 1 said that was correct he would not
do anything. Staff 1 then walked away, and Youth A bumped him. Staff 1 put his arm
out to protect himself. Staff 1 said he could see how it would look like a push to
others. Staff 4 then walked up and separated them. Staff 1 said there were three
other staff present but he could not recall their names. Staff 1 was left to deal with
the situation on his own and he did the best he could given the situation he was put
4

in. Staff 1 said he never pushed Youth A, called him names, or challenged him. Staff
1 said he was scared not mad. Staff 1 resigned from his position because he did not
feel safe.
Documents Reviewed:
 Youth A’s file: Admitted to the facility on 4/6/22. He has a history of stealing,
lacking respect for authority, argumentative, defiant, and has trouble
processing his emotions. Youth A saw the nurse on 7/18/2. He did not have
any bruises or scratches on his body.
 Staff 1 employee file documents: Staff 1 was hired 6/27/22. He was in new
hire training from 6/27/22 to 7/8/22. He only worked 4 shifts and did not have
any disciplines. Staff 1 received verbal de-escalation training through
Therapeutic Crisis Intervention (TCI) from 6/28/22 to 7/1/22. He received
training in trauma informed care on 7/5/22 and policies and procedures on
7/7/22.
 Discipline Policy: The policy states the facility does not allow any form of
corporal punishment and/or inappropriate hands-on intervention which
includes pushes, among others. This was electronically signed by Staff 1 on
6/15/22.
During the DHHS Case Conference on 8/15/22 the DHHS Worker indicated she had
no findings.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow
written policies and procedures that prohibit the following
forms of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing
a youth on any part of their body.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in violation of this rule as both staff and
youth witnesses saw Staff 1 push Youth A.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
